entry.et: Middle English reduccion restoration, from Middle French reducion, from Late Latin & Latin; Late Latin reduction-, reductio reduction (in a syllogism), from Latin, restoration, from reducere

def.dt: :the act or process of reducing :the state of being reduced
:the amount by which something is reduced
def.set: Spanish reducción, from Latin reduction-, reductio
def.dt: :a South American Indian settlement directed by Jesuit missionaries
:production of the gametic chromosome number in the first meiotic division
:the usually first division of meiosis in which chromosome reduction occurs
:a combination of gears used to reduce the input speed (as of a marine turbine) to a lower output speed (as of a ship's propeller)
:a chemical reaction in which one or more electrons are transferred from one atom or molecule to another
